perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "Watley"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changes 'ABW' to 'Watley' as the defined term for A.B. Watley, Inc. This introduces inconsistency as later mentions of ABW will be ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and Watley and all affiliated entities, including subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.explanation: Replaces 'ABW' with 'Watley' and 'their subsidiaries and related companies' with 'all affiliated entities, including subsidiaries and related companies'. This creates uncertainty whether affiliated entities includes subsidiaries and related companies or something else.

perturbation.original_text:
AGREED TO BY:
/s/ Steven Malin
/s/ Howard Meltzer
- --------------------------
---------------------------------
A.B. Watley, Inc.
PC Quote, Inc.
perturbation.changed_text:
AGREED TO BY:
/s/ Steven Malin
/s/ Howard Meltzer
- --------------------------
---------------------------------
Watley Inc.
PC Quote, Inc.
perturbation.explanation: Changes 'A.B. Watley, Inc.' to 'Watley Inc.'. Because 'Watley' and 'Watley Inc.' are used interchangeably without defining whether they are in fact the same entity, this could create a dispute during enforcement.
